Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you stands a broad-shouldered woman clad in battered studded armor and a mud-stained cloak. A deep red bandana crosses her brow, and her eyes flick up and down your frame, wary and piercing.

"Stop there. Name's Brekka. I keep the night watch, whether folk like it or not. I’ve got little patience for drifters and less for spies.
And I’ve been watching you. So—state your business, or turn around and head back to whatever swamp spat you out."

Option.text: Just a traveler, looking for honest work.
Are you accusing me of something?
You seem on edge. Trouble brewing?
Who put you in charge, anyway?
Never mind, I’ll be on my way.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She crosses her arms, steel eyes never leaving yours.

"Honest work, eh? Lot of folk say that. Some go missing, some get caught slipping notes to Minax's mongrels, and a few end up with a knife in their back—mine, if I catch them."

"You want work? Prove you’re no snake in the grass. There’s a beast out there—ChromaticOgre, clever for an ogre, mean as sin. Bring me its tusk and I’ll have less reason to think you’re a spy. Maybe."

Option.text: What makes you think there’s a spy in town?
Tell me about this ChromaticOgre.
Why do you distrust outsiders?
Fine, I’ll take the job.
On second thought, I’ll pass.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brekka leans in, voice low and sharp.

"I trust what I see, and I see strangers at our gates while Minax’s filth creeps closer every moon. Funny thing—spies never say they’re spies, do they?"
"But actions talk. You want my trust? Earn it. There’s work fit for the bold, and the clean-handed. Or are you just passing through?"

Option.text: What work?
Not interested in games.
You seem to know a lot about spies. Old habits?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brekka’s jaw clenches, but a sly grin tugs at her mouth.
"Wasn’t always a watchman, if that’s what you’re poking at. Used to run with a rough crew before Halric gave me a chance—first man in Eldermoor who offered me mercy instead of a noose. I pay that debt in blood, every day. So don’t test me."

Option.text: Why’d you change sides?
Alright, about that work…

Dialogue.NPCText:
"There’s only two kinds of folk left out here—those who build, and those who burn. I got tired of burning, and Eldermoor needed fighters more than outlaws. So I put down my old colors and picked up the town’s."
"Now I keep the peace, and sometimes, that means watching for old friends in new masks. Or new enemies with old tricks."

Option.text: What can I do to prove myself?
I’m not here to cause trouble.

Dialogue.NPCText: "If you mean that, do the job. The ogre’s a real threat—and I’d sleep better knowing someone new can handle themselves."

Option.text: I’ll do it.
I’ll think about it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brekka nods to the battered palisade, then scans the horizon.
"Always trouble. Minax’s monsters sniff at our fences. Mayor Halric’s lost too much sleep to trust anyone, Edda’s got her eye on the woods, and I’ve heard Mira wants to run off to Sunreach. But the real trouble is inside—folk turning on each other, afraid every shadow’s a traitor."

Option.text: Sounds like you don’t trust your own town.
I want to help, not cause trouble.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She snorts, adjusting the battered ironbound jerkin she wears.
"No one put me anywhere. I took up arms when raiders hit, and folk followed because I was louder, meaner, and didn’t die easy. Halric grumbles, but even he knows it—sometimes, you need a bad woman on your side."

Option.text: You and Halric get along?
I want to prove myself.

Dialogue.NPCText: "He’s stubborn as a frost ox, but fair. I owe him. Doesn’t mean we always see eye to eye—he’d rather talk, I’d rather act. But Eldermoor needs both, if it’s going to survive."

Option.text: I respect that. How can I help?
Sounds complicated. Maybe I’ll move on.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brekka’s voice drops, serious.
"We learned to keep our doors shut since Lord British vanished and the cityfolk forgot we exist. Sometimes it’s for the best. But if you want in—earn your place. One good deed counts for more than a hundred pretty words."

Option.text: What deed would that be?
Fair enough. Goodbye.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brekka gestures toward the marsh beyond town, her voice rough.

"The ChromaticOgre—ugly brute, rainbow scars across its hide, mean as hunger. It’s clever, for an ogre. Stole chickens last week, smashed Thalen’s supply cart, and yesterday it dragged a sheep off right under Aldric’s nose. Worst of all, it seems to vanish into the fog, only showing itself when it wants to."

"Some folk whisper it’s been touched by Minax’s magic—changes color in the moonlight, maybe even talks. I don’t know about that, but I do know it’s left three corpses behind."

"So here’s your chance: Hunt it down. Bring me a tusk as proof. If you’re as brave as you say, you’ll earn both coin and my watchful eye… less watchful, maybe."

Option.text: I’ll take down the ChromaticOgre.
How dangerous is it, really?
Why not send Thalen or Aldric?
This all sounds like Minax’s work.
I’ll think about it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brekka offers a rare, approving nod.

"Good. It prowls near the old willow stand by dusk, sometimes slinks up by the marsh at dawn. Watch the ground—those colors it wears aren’t just for show. Some say it hypnotizes, but I say it’s just mean."

"Bring me its tusk and you’ll have gold, a pint at Brenvar’s inn, and a little less suspicion from me. Don’t die quick."

Option.text: Understood. I’ll be back—with proof.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brekka’s brow furrows.

"It’s not just big, it’s clever. Painted stripes—blue, green, gold—like some carnival beast. Hard to spot at dusk. Edda claims it talks to itself in riddles. And I’ve seen wounds on it heal, quick as a blink. Minax’s magic, if you ask me."
"But its weak spot is pride. Challenge it and it’ll come running. Just don’t let it land the first hit."

Option.text: Sounds nasty. I’ll handle it.
Maybe another time.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Thalen’s got a hammer, not a sword, and Aldric… well, he’s better with wolves than ogres. Besides, I’d rather risk a stranger than one of our own. Mira’s too quick-witted for this sort of brute work."

Option.text: Fine, I’ll do it.
Not my fight.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"I’d bet my boots on it. Mira swears she saw the beast’s eyes glow violet when the moon rose, and Aldric found strange runes in the mud. Edda thinks the ogre is just a sick animal, but I know dark magic when I see it."
"You want to impress me? Bring back anything odd you find on its corpse—a rune, a token, whatever. The town’s got enough secrets without letting Minax’s curses walk our fields."

Option.text: All the more reason to end it.
This is bigger than I thought. I’ll return.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"I keep a list. No one leaves, no one enters, not without me knowing. But someone’s been slipping through—strange tracks by the east gate, a missing crate of steel, gossip where it shouldn’t be."
"I have my eyes on half this town, including you. Prove you’re not the problem—handle the ogre, help the people, and maybe I’ll stop watching you every minute."

Option.text: Then give me a chance to prove myself.
Trust goes both ways, you know.
If you’re wrong, you owe me an apology.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brekka snorts.
"Don’t hold your breath, but maybe I’ll buy you a drink at Brenvar’s if you live through this. Not many do."

Option.text: We’ll see. I’ll take your job.
No thanks. I’ll find my own way.
